summary.para: Requests that a folder object resolve a Shell link.

param.name: punkLink
param.para: Pointer to the object's interface. This interface can then be queried to determine the contents of the link.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Handle to the window that the Shell uses as the parent for a dialog box. The Shell displays the dialog box if it needs to prompt the user for more information while resolving the link.

param.name: fFlags
param.para: Action flags. This parameter can be a combination of the following values.

Disable distributed link tracking. By default, distributed link tracking tracks removable media across multiple devices based on the volume name. It also uses the UNC path to track remote file systems whose drive letter has changed. Setting SLR_NOLINKINFO disables both types of tracking.

Do not display a dialog box if the link cannot be resolved. When SLR_NO_UI is set, the high-order word of fFlags specifies a time-out duration, in milliseconds. The function returns if the link cannot be resolved within the time-out duration. If the high-order word is set to zero, the time-out duration defaults to 3000 milliseconds (3 seconds).
Do not update the link information.
Do not execute the search heuristics.
Do not use distributed link tracking.
If the link object has changed, update its path and list of identifiers. If SLR_UPDATE is set, you do not need to call to determine whether the link object has changed.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method should attempt to find the target of a Shell link, even if the target has been moved or renamed.

member.name: IResolveShellLink

summary.para: Exposes a method that enables an application to request that a Shell folder object resolve a link for one of its items.

member.remarks:
Namespace extensions implement this object to support link resolution.
This interface is not typically used by applications.
With namespace extensions, shortcut objects (.lnk files) implement the essential functionality of by calling . IResolveShellLink is exported by a link resolution object that is created on request by the Shell folder.
To retrieve a pointer to a link resolution object's IResolveShellLink interface:
For an object that is contained by a folder, call the folder's method and request an IResolveShellLink pointer (IID_IResolveShellLink).
For the folder object itself, call the folder's method and request an IResolveShellLink pointer (IID_IResolveShellLink).
Note Prior to Windows Vista this interface was declared in Shlobj.h.
